Description is vague about what 'child' means in this context and doesn't clarify input/output formats. Added clarity about parent-child relationships, input requirements, and return value structure for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Get child UUID(s) from a specified project or publisher UUID.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve child UUIDs for a resource
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all child UUIDs associated with a specified parent resource (project or publisher). Accepts a parent UUID as input and returns a collection of child UUIDs registered in the CyCAT catalogue. Useful for exploring hierarchical relationships within the cybersecurity resource catalogue.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is vague about what 'child' means in this context and doesn't clarify input/output formats. Added clarity about parent-child relationships, input requirements, and return value structure for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'get_generate_uuid' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description has grammatical issues and lacks clarity about return format and use case. Enhanced to explain no inputs required, output format, and practical application within the CyCAT context.

data.description_suggestion: Generates a new UUID version 4 that is RFC4122-compliant. This operation requires no input parameters and returns a newly generated UUID string. Useful for creating unique identifiers for new resources in the CyCAT catalogue.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description has grammatical issues and lacks clarity about return format and use case. Enhanced to explain no inputs required, output format, and practical application within the CyCAT context.

message: Operation 'get_list_project' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Missing summary. data.current_description: List projects registered in CyCAT by pagination (start,end).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of projects registered in the CyCAT catalogue. Accepts start and end parameters to define the pagination range. Returns an array of project objects containing project metadata and identifiers. Useful for browsing or enumerating all available cybersecurity projects in the catalogue.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about return format and practical use. Added explanation of pagination parameters, return value structure, and domain context to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.summary_suggestion: Look up a UUID in CyCAT
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a UUID registered in the CyCAT catalogue. Accepts a UUID as input and returns the associated resource metadata including type, namespace, and related information. Returns null or an error if the UUID is not found in the catalogue.

data.current_description: Get all known UUID for a given namespace id.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all known UUIDs associated with a given namespace and namespace ID within the CyCAT catalogue. data.current_description: Get parent UUID(s) from a specified project or item UUID.

message: Operation 'post_propose' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Missing summary. Description is too vague about inputs and outputs. Enhanced version specifies that it requires request body data, clarifies the return value, and importantly explains the side effect (resource enters review workflow) so AI agents understand this is not an immediate addition.

data.description_suggestion: Submits a proposal for a new cybersecurity resource to be added to the CyCAT catalogue. Accepts resource metadata in the request body. Returns a proposal identifier and status. The proposed resource enters a review workflow and does not immediately appear in the catalogue until approved by CyCAT administrators.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is too vague about inputs and outputs. Enhanced version specifies that it requires request body data, clarifies the return value, and importantly explains the side effect (resource enters review workflow) so AI agents understand this is not an immediate addition.
